item.title: Help [getting online] **NO DUMBASSES**
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

To get the server online, you open the “Run batch” file. If you get an error saying it’s not recognized set your JDK path correctly.

You clearly are just posting random code, not saying whats wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Help [getting online] **NO DUMBASSES**
item.dc:creator: @iamminesmith iamminesmith
item.description:
@iamminesmith wrote:

[code][ACCOUNT]

character-password = 42f67d67e8bb0a2b6efbb42b6cdb7211

[CHARACTER]

character-pouch2 = 0
character-pouch3 = 0
character-pouch4 = 0
character-energy = 100
character-taskID = -1
character-taskAmount = -1[/code]

how do i get my server online, i need to know ive looked throughout my source, here are some of my client.java and server.java parts:

Client.java (1)

[code]return NewID;
}

public int GetWorld(int PlayerID) {
	String Server = PlayerHandler.players[PlayerID].playerServer;

	if (Server.equals("127.0.0.1") || Server.equals("localhost")) {
		return 1;
	} else if (Server.equals("metallica.zapto.org")) {
		return 2;
	} else {[/code]

Client.java (2)

[code]int expectedUid = 10204; //10202
if (junk == expectedUid) {
officialClient = true;
}

		if ((playerName == null) || (playerName.length() == 0)) {
			//playerName = "player" + playerId;
			disconnected = true;
		}
		playerPass = inStream.readString();

		try {
			playerServer = inStream.readString();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			playerServer = "127.0.0.1";
		}

		playerName = playerName.toLowerCase();
		playerPass = playerPass.toLowerCase();[/code]

Server.java

	public void run() {
		// setup the listener
		try {
			shutdownClientHandler = false;
			clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1,
					null);
			misc.println("Your server is now online.");
			while (true) {
				try {
					java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();
					s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
					String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
					if ( /*
					 * connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") ||
					 * connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")
					 */true) {
if(clientListener == null){
s.close();
}
						if (connectingHost.contains("74-129-182-147.dhcp.insightbb.com")) {
							misc.println("Checking Server Status...");
							s.close();
						} else {
							connections.add(connectingHost);
							if (checkHost(connectingHost)) {
								misc.println("Connection from "
										+ connectingHost + ":" + s.getPort());
							playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
							} else {
								misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "
										+ connectingHost + ":" + s.getPort());
								s.close();
							}[/code]

please help


ALSO here is my protforwarding info:: ( Netgear router)
[code]Ports - Custom Services
 
Service Name         metallica.zapto.org
Service Type         TCP/UDP
Starting Port       43594        (1~65534)
Ending Port         43594        (1~65534)
Server IP Address         192.168.1.100         <----- (Questions about this...)

Also Tried to check port 43594 and this is what i got:

Error: I could not see your service on 174.102.126.28 on port (43594) Reason: Connection timed out

I can log onto my server but it is offline and i log on from 127.0.0.1

Your server is now online. Connection from 127.0.0.1:62662 [client-1-Jay]: Loading Process Completed [Has powers, lag: 1 ms]
